attributes.action: Enforce the Highway Code for supermarket trolley users
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Shopping in the supermarket would be more efficient and less dangerous if everyone knew where they stood with regard to their rights of way, and everyone followed a set trolley protocol. We propose that a cut-down form of the Highway Code should be enforced in supermarkets, and appropriate road markings (Stop junctions, double-yellow lines etc) and rules (speed limits, always push on the left, etc) be enforced.

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
